newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares end slightly up, Volvo slides.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares end slightly up, Volvo slides.

text.p: Swedish share prices ended marginally higher on Friday as gains in telecoms company Ericsson and the investment sector outweighed a fall in drug company Astra.
The stock market's general index rose 0.32 percent to 2,753.76 and turnover totalled 5.6 billion crowns.
Ericsson rose three crowns to 265.5 and Astra fell 4.5 crowns to 311.
"Ericsson feels strong and there were several real investors behind the trade...People should not take the fall off the session highs seriously," one broker said.
Vehicle maker Volvo fell six crowns to 209 on profit-taking.

Investment company Incentive jumped 39 crowns to 604. Investor rose 10 crowns to 372. Brokers said the rise was probably because Investor's managing director Claes Dahlback spent time in the United States this week talking to investors. The investment sector index rose 2.2 percent.
